title: 31.1 Elementary Number-Theoretic Notions
content:
Section 31.1

Elementary Number-Theoretic Notions

Summary

Divisibility, primes, and modular arithmetic basics.

Key Points

  • a divides b (a|b) if b = ak for some integer k
  • Prime: p > 1 with only divisors 1 and p
  • Fundamental theorem: unique prime factorization
  • gcd(a,b): largest d dividing both a and b
  • Relatively prime: gcd(a,b) = 1

Example

gcd(24, 36) = 12. 24 = 2³·3, 36 = 2²·3². gcd = 2²·3 = 12.

Why It Matters

Foundation for cryptography and many algorithms.
